website_summaries.verdict: This moderately priced machine renders a fantastic pasta-making experience. An outstanding value for the money.
pros: Excellent build quality and pasta production
cons: Fewer thickness settings than some competitors

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy
customer_reviews.text: Was replacing a workhorse pasta machine that I should have returned when I got it since the linguini roll NEVER worked but loved nonetheless. And when the clamp stripped I needed a new machine. This machine was truly a disappointment because we all have trouble changing the thinness dial. For whatever reason the dial part is not well made and easy to manipulate. That being said the linguini roll part works so I bought a new clamp for the workhorse machine and use this machine to roll out the linguini. But to buy this as your only machine would be a disaster!
customer_reviews.author: Mary G. Wiesemann

customer_reviews.title: Bye bye store bought pasta
customer_reviews.text: Bought two, one for me, one for a friend. Big pasta eaters in the house, I already make my own sauces, decided to try to make pasta. I didn’t go for the top of the line, or one that’s upgradable just to see how it would go. This thing is easy to use! First time trying it out and the pasta came out like pasta! I watched a couple YouTube videos prior, of course, but even without them the machine is easy to use and understand. I don’t like store bought pastas after making my own
customer_reviews.author: Addy Daddy

customer_reviews.title: Very good.
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product, it's very easy to use and I like how the lever comes out and you switch it to whichever section of the machine you'd like to use. My pasta came out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley H.

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for a few months now and quite like it, with one exception, changing the thickness of the pasta sheets is kinda hard. You need something non slip on the knob to not only turn it, but to push in and turn at the same time. Apart from that, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: damaged
customer_reviews.text: There is a large deep gouge in the roller and also a scratch in the same roller. I'm returning it asap.
customer_reviews.author: kathy caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Grandma couldn't turn the dial. I almost couldnt turn the dial
customer_reviews.text: I found the dial on the back side of the pasta maker was unbelievably difficult to turn. I had several other people try it over the course of the last few weeks..... its not just me...... it is in fact difficult to turn. Other than requiring clean hands and a few good attempts at notching it down to the next thinness level, it does the job well. But, I also only use it to roll out the dough, I dont use the pasta shredders. I am hoping in time, it will fix itself.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Devine

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing more than words can say
customer_reviews.text: The only down side is the grip for holding it to the surface is awkward / doesn't seem to fit as perfectly as other parts/pieces. And sometimes the turning handle strikes the vice. Outside of that, I love, love, love it. So much fun. It's like having an adult Play-Doh fun factory that you can eat.
customer_reviews.author: At Home in My Head

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: The only thing about this product is the instructions are better in Italian than English. Sort of like reading the Bible in 14th century English lol! Made my first batch of pasta and cooked up. It was delish. Used fresh ground wheat flour and eggs and an extra sturdy mixer. Picture fo follow
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product! We love making our own pasta and ravioli now! It was a gift for my mother for Christmas, and she loved it! The only problem is that it is slightly hard to keep it in one place when it is attached to the counter. It moves around a bit. Otherwise it was great! The box it came in had been punctured by the handle of the pasta roller as well. Otherwise it was great!
customer_reviews.author: Amandalynn Parkinson

customer_reviews.title: Good, heavy duty construction. Should last forever.
customer_reviews.text: Love this heavy duty pasta roller. The box was damaged but the product seems fine. Have already made flat noodles and spaghetti. Heavy duty construction so I expect this to last for years. The manual does not contain much information but it's pretty easy to figure out. Watch YouTube for recipes and instructions.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: That old phrase "They don't make 'em like they used too" certainly does NOT apply to the ...
customer_reviews.text: I'll keep this review short because I'd just be repeating most of the other 5 star reviews. Heavy? YES! Which translates as "built to last". That old phrase "They don't make 'em like they used too" certainly does NOT apply to the Titania Imperia pasta machine. So happy I didn't get one of the "cheaper" machines instead. Thank you Imperia!
customer_reviews.author: Jono G.

customer_reviews.title: Not an actual Cucina Pro pasta maker and should not be advertised as Cucina Pro
customer_reviews.text: Advise to myself, look at all the pictures of the product. I thought I was buying an actual Cucina Pro pasta maker but what I got was a Titania pasta machine made by Imperia & Monferrina which appears to be a good company.
customer_reviews.author: James Potter

customer_reviews.title: Great small pasta machine
customer_reviews.text: Love that it's not electric and small. Easy to use and sturdy
customer_reviews.author: A. Bosque

customer_reviews.title: so so so good.
customer_reviews.text: Made some of the best pasta I've ever had but more than that, it made great memories of cooking with my mom. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Odin__wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I've used this a couple of times and it's awesome! Perfect for home use. My only constructive criticism is that I have found i need to tighten a couple of times or it starts to come loose but the machine itself is very sturdy. Other than that all has been great :)
customer_reviews.author: S Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Ok but need something else
customer_reviews.text: The handler is falling off constantly and the thickness switch is really hard to switch once the machine gets floury
customer_reviews.author: Diana Machkhidze

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Have been making a lot of pastas with it and it works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Chia Yuan Hsu

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Smooth Function, Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I researched affordable, high quality machines and the Imperia kept coming to the top. This machine is solid, smooth in the hand crank function enough to know I likely will not need to purchase the optional motor. The first batch came out perfect!
customer_reviews.author: River

customer_reviews.title: If you already have a model designed like I have described
customer_reviews.text: The base is too small and the screw-down anchor on only one side leaves the machine wobbly. What is it designed to be anchored to? My plan is to drill holes in all 4 corners and bolt it to a a large bread board so it does not require being held by 2 hands while turning the handles. If you already have a model designed like I have described, please let me know and I will buy one. Thanks for asking. Jim Fisher
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good price
customer_reviews.text: service and delivery very good. bough for a gift has not ben used yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald E.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the only downside is it needs to be bolted down if you want it more secure.
customer_reviews.author: tiff

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. The first use you have to roll the ...
customer_reviews.text: Used twice now. So far so good. The first use you have to roll the dough through the machine for many times to remove some black dirty stuff out of it.
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Makes great pasta.
customer_reviews.text: Makes great pasta... BUT it's kind of a two person job. One hand to hold dough going in, one hand to crank handle, and another needed to handle the pasta coming out of pasta maker. Also, I didn't like the way it was packaged...just put in the box. No wrap, no styrophome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife as a present and we both love it. Very well made and easy to use/clean. I had no idea how easy and delicious fresh pasta was.
customer_reviews.author: Five-Bees

customer_reviews.title: but love that it is able to press more than one ...
customer_reviews.text: Haven't gotten to use this product yet, but love that it is able to press more than one type of pasta. Since it has the crank, it will be great to use off-grid too. I know that I am going to love it.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna Atkinson

customer_reviews.title: Not as picture shows
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected. Picture of item when I ordered showed (3) or more types of pasta that could be made.Once my order arrived it makes only (2). For the other pasta,s you have to order (2) more attachments.If I had known this at the time I ordered I probably would have not ordered this product.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Luna

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great! I made about 2 lbs of pasta in under an hour. Pretty self explanatory and had no problems with assembly or bolting down.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Mozdrzech

customer_reviews.title: Go online for great recipes
customer_reviews.text: Making fresh pasta is easy and the taste is far better than store bought.
customer_reviews.author: linda ann lester

customer_reviews.title: Great pasta maker
customer_reviews.text: Made pasta several times already. Easy to use and makes great pasta
customer_reviews.author: Paul Zivich

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: Used it last week. Works well. Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't mount at all on my kitchen counter. There is no clear English directions as to how to mount the unit. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Tim Pattrin

customer_reviews.title: Need English instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Wish that there were English instructions with the product. The one picture is not very helpful. Would not have bought it if we knew there were no English instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Chatter

customer_reviews.title: Great quality machine!
customer_reviews.text: This is a useful machine for making pasta with my son! The pasta sizes are exactly to my likings, and the machine quality is great. This is worth every single dollar!
customer_reviews.author: chau tran

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use....
customer_reviews.text: Once getting the pasta maker, you attach it to the table or counter top and "poof" it's ready to use. After making the dough, you place it in the machine and it makes perfect pasta every time.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Vanas

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Better than I expected. Better quality than I expected. Fasted delivery than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mitzi Koch

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: An excellent sturdy product, I'm glad I bought the Imperia Titania 190 pasta maker. So much fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, YOU GET 3 HEADS, for the price that KITCHEN AID wants for their"s it's a steal.
customer_reviews.author: richard w. barone

customer_reviews.title: Love making pasta
customer_reviews.text: Works just like the one we used in Lucca last fall. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: David  DeBastos

customer_reviews.title: Awsome, works great, just what I need.
customer_reviews.text: Must have tool in the Kitchen.Love it. Highly recommenanded. Everybody in the family love's to make pasta now. Thanks a million.
customer_reviews.author: Erwin Toews

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's just like my old one but bigger. Love it
customer_reviews.author: Eleanor  MacLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: 3 Machines arrived between April 28-April 30 but were not ...
customer_reviews.text: 3 Machines arrived between April 28-April 30 but were not taken out of the box and used until Saturday, July 30. On one machine the roll did not roll so it did not pull the pasta thru the machine---BROKE. A second machine has a part loose and will not work. Just found out the opportunity to return the defective machines expired May 30, 2016. Sorry policy!!
customer_reviews.author: Lorie L. Lacina

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, should include a cleaning kit to get some dough out.
customer_reviews.author: Peter9982

customer_reviews.title: I love the pasta maker machine and wanted to give one ...
customer_reviews.text: Sadly, the box was mislabeled with the wrong bar code. The box contained the MOTOR and not the MACHINE we ordered. We returned it twice. I love the pasta maker machine and wanted to give one to my sister. We were disappointed twice.
customer_reviews.author: ebathen

customer_reviews.title: Works pretty well. I previously had an Atlas which had ...
customer_reviews.text: Works pretty well. I previously had an Atlas which had a dial for changing the space between the rollers that worked MUCH more easily than does the dial for this model. Maybe with increased use the dial (or operator!) will work more fluidly. As with all similar models, it is tough to get the counter top clamp to hold the machine tightly while under the strain of cranking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Appeared Used Upon Arrival
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product and when I opened the package, the product had flour on it which made me think the product was used prior to arrival.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love pasta and noodles. And this is great. I was worried if I can only make two size of pasta but that wasn't the case. I can make thin pasta like angel hair or thick like chowmein or spaghetti by just adjusting the thickness of the dough before running in the cutter part. One thing to be careful however, if you make your dough wide enough to touch the edge of the rollers, some black stuff will rub off and onto your dough. Not sure if it's grease or dirt but something to watch out for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Choi

customer_reviews.title: Requires 2 hands to change the thickness setting
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this machine but changing the roller setting was difficult and time-consuming, even with 2 hands, unlike my smaller 150 mm Marcato Atlas machine which is easy to change with just one hand. It may be less than 1/2 the price of the 180 mm Marcato but the reason why is obvious.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jordan

customer_reviews.title: making pasta for the first time
customer_reviews.text: Used the enclosed recipe to make my first batch of spaghetti and noodles. I only use organic flours and they worked perfect for my noodles. Will be making a lot of pasta from now on. Fast shipping, arrived on Saturday ahead of the scheduled Monday.
customer_reviews.author: MI farm girl

customer_reviews.title: Crank keeps falling out
customer_reviews.text: Crank keeps falling out when you're in the swing of things and then you need three hands. Packaging too weak for how heavy the machine is. It came all torn up.
customer_reviews.author: I. A.

customer_reviews.title: Handle keeps falling off very often and it also hits the clamp when turning...
customer_reviews.text: We tried every possible way to clamp it on our counter top, the handle kept hitting the clamp when we turned it. Another annoying thing was the handle itself, it kept falling off when slightly hit by anything. It didn't have a locking mechanism to hold it tight.
customer_reviews.author: TechExpert2013

customer_reviews.title: This imperfection should have never passed the factory inspection!
customer_reviews.text: Imperfections that should have never been on those very expensive pots before they were either fixed or disqualified for sale to the unsuspecting customers. The trouble of buying and replacing is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: Came in a beat up box. Can't go as thin as I would like it to go. I should've sucked it up and bought the Atlas for an additional $20. But other than that if you are looking for a sturdy easy to use pasta maker then this is the best bang for your buck. Easy to use, easy cleaning, and very well made, Doesn't feel cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: it's ok
customer_reviews.text: It's ok for the money but I really hate the control knob.You have to keep fiddling with it and at times it is hard to turn.
customer_reviews.author: redpeterbilt

customer_reviews.title: Bottom line if you are looking for a sturdy pasta maker better check out some other brands
customer_reviews.text: I used this machine only during our new year to make noodles. It broke down this year and I found out some defect with the design. The main roller's connection to the handle is plastic as shown in the picture. Unlike the other two connectors (to make pasta) are all metal. No wonder the dough comes out uneven during my earlier use because of the plastic interior of the main roller, it make it wobbly. It broke after only three use. There is no option to return this since its been three years but I have only used it thrice so far. Bottom line if you are looking for a sturdy pasta maker better check out some other brands.
customer_reviews.author: ttt

customer_reviews.title: This is 1to buy, perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: AAA+++ DEFINITELY WORTH IT WOULD BUY 4 A GIFT AS WELL AWESOMENESS!!!
customer_reviews.author: SIEBENDUXXX

customer_reviews.title: A very good product.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for Xmas present for my husband. He absolutely loves it. He have pasta twice a week now.
customer_reviews.author: Fireside reader

customer_reviews.title: The best basic pasta machine around
customer_reviews.text: I own and have used the original Imperia pasta maker for a long time. The bearings are metal, not nylon like the Atlas brand, and as a result they last much longer. When it came time to get a second, I wanted something a bit more compact. The Titania is that, with the two cutters one must often uses built in (Fettuccine and Chitara, the latter being square-cut spaghetti). The machine is still extensible and can take attachments for other cutting dies, but because the basic ones are built in, it is more stable and has a lower center of mass and smaller footprint. This is my new favorite!
customer_reviews.author: PhysProf

customer_reviews.title: SUPER
customer_reviews.text: VERY STRONG AND WELL MADE ENJOY MAKING PASTA. IT WILL TAKE A LITTLE FOR ME TO GET THE HANG MAKING PASTA BUT I WILL LEARN
customer_reviews.author: Marcia S.

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite toys. Works great and cranks out very thin ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite toys. Works great and cranks out very thin spaghetti, just like I like it. Quality look and feel. Always looking for the opportunity to use it. Best spaghetti I every ate.
customer_reviews.author: Randy J

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, only draw back is handle keeps coming ...
customer_reviews.text: Great machine,only draw back is handle keeps coming off and the instructions leave a lot to be desired.Make no mistake,this is a quality made machine.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nigro

customer_reviews.title: The quality is nice. The only down side is that the knob ...
customer_reviews.text: The quality is nice. The only down side is that the knob on the left side is a little bit hard to turn. Other than that is a nice machine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, price and service
customer_reviews.text: Great quality product, especially for the price. Shipping was much quicker than anticipated and I am very happy with the product and the supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Lylusal

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband and he loves it! Works great!
customer_reviews.author: Alice Dalatri

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: The crank handle falls out, but I love the idea of making my own pasta, and the machine does a great job
customer_reviews.author: 182 pilot

customer_reviews.title: effective way to make small quantities of great pasta.
customer_reviews.text: Simple, effective way to make small quantities of great pasta.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph T. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Junk....Get a diff brand
customer_reviews.text: Hold down system is chinsy and it's difficult to clean. Fine roller makes corrugated sheets instead of cutting. Cleaning instructions are lacking...Machine is worth $19.95 tops
customer_reviews.author: Jorg

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: My daughter uses this to make homemade pasta. Wow. Also bought with Norpro Ravioli Maker and Norpro Pasta Drying Rack. It was worth it to spend a few pennies more and get something that is a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The box is completely broken, it was suppose to be a present, how can I give it in this condition?!
customer_reviews.author: Cliente Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Just received this today and I wasn't happy with the condition of the box
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today and I wasn't happy with the condition of the box. The box looks like it's been through a lot. I also get the feeling when I open the box that the unit was just placed in there. No wrapping Or anything and it obviously has been open many times before. Yuk! I hope the machine is in working order??!
customer_reviews.author: Tmark

product_meta.title: CucinaPro Pasta Maker Machine, Large, Stainless
product_meta.description: The Imperia Titania chromium-plated steel pasta machine is precision engineered in Italy, sturdy and built to last. Producing a 150mm leaf in 6 thicknesses which is then cut to 2mm (tagliatelle) or 6.5mm (fettuccine). Can connected to the motor Imperia PastaFacile, to produce large quantities rapidly without effort.
feature_bullets: Pasta Maker- Exclusive, elegant and easy to use pasta machines
Pasta Machine- Prepares Lasagna sheets from manually prepared dough that can be then cut
Guaranteed to make fresh safe and clean pasta noodles
Do not wash - Never put in the dishwasher

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,070 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
